original_sap_section_used.ends_at: 10.3. Vital Signs, Weight and Body Surface Area

evaluation_table.original_sap_text: Actual result and change from baseline of all numeric laboratory parameters including clinical chemistry, hematology, numeric urinalysis and coagulation will be summarized
evaluation_table.generated_sap_text: Clinical laboratory assessments include hematology, clinical chemistry, urinalysis, and coagulation.
evaluation_table.protocol_text: Clinical laboratory tests: hematology, clinical chemistry, urinalysis
evaluation_table.reasoning: Both documents list the same four main categories.

evaluation_table.generated_sap_text: Laboratory samples will be collected according to the Schedule of Assessments (Section 11.1).
evaluation_table.protocol_text: Blood and urine samples for clinical laboratory assessments will be collected at the time points specified in the schedule of events (Table 11-1).
evaluation_table.reasoning: Generated SAP refers to the schedule of assessments, which is consistent with standard practice and the Protocol.

evaluation_table.original_sap_text: Clinical laboratory test samples will be analyzed at the local laboratory. Reported units and normal ranges are various among sites. Reported units will be converted to standard units, if applicable.
evaluation_table.generated_sap_text: Clinical laboratory test samples will be analyzed at the local laboratory for routine monitoring; however, data will be standardized to International System (SI) units for reporting and analysis.
evaluation_table.protocol_text: Clinical laboratory test samples will be analyzed at the local laboratory.
evaluation_table.reasoning: Both specify local laboratory analysis and standardization of units.

evaluation_table.original_sap_text: The CTCAE terms and ranges for applicable parameters are listed in Appendix 14.2.
evaluation_table.generated_sap_text: Hematology: Hematocrit, hemoglobin, white blood cell count, absolute neutrophil count (ANC), and platelets.
evaluation_table.protocol_text: Hematology: hematocrit, hemoglobin, white blood cell count, absolute neutrophil count and platelets
evaluation_table.reasoning: Generated SAP lists specific parameters matching the Protocol. Original SAP refers to an appendix. This is an acceptable difference.

evaluation_table.original_sap_text: The CTCAE terms and ranges for applicable parameters are listed in Appendix 14.2.
evaluation_table.generated_sap_text: Clinical Chemistry: Albumin, alkaline phosphatase (ALP), alanine aminotransferase (ALT), aspartate aminotransferase (AST), blood urea nitrogen (BUN), calcium, chloride, creatine phosphokinase (CPK), creatine kinase-myocardial band (CK-MB) isoenzyme, total cholesterol, creatinine, creatinine clearance (CrCl) (estimated by Cockcroft-Gault formula, see Section 11.6), gamma-glutamyl transferase (GGT), glucose, lactate dehydrogenase (LDH), triglyceride, high-density lipoprotein (HDL) cholesterol, phosphate, potassium, sodium, total bilirubin, direct bilirubin, total protein, and uric acid.
evaluation_table.protocol_text: Clinical chemistry: albumin, alkaline phosphatase, alanine aminotransferase, aspartate aminotransferase, blood urea nitrogen, calcium, chloride, creatine phosphokinase, creatine kinase-myocardial band isoenzyme, total cholesterol, creatinine, CrCl (estimated by weight and by Cockcroft-Gault formula), gamma-glutamyl transferase, glucose, lactate dehydrogenase, triglyceride, high-density lipoprotein cholesterol, phosphate, potassium, sodium, total bilirubin, direct bilirubin, total protein, uric acid
evaluation_table.reasoning: Generated SAP lists specific parameters matching the Protocol. Original SAP refers to an appendix. This is an acceptable difference.

evaluation_table.original_sap_text: The results for all non-numeric urinalysis parameters including microscopic urinalysis collected as qualitative format will be categorized into normal and abnormal...
evaluation_table.generated_sap_text: Urinalysis: Bilirubin, blood, glucose, ketones, leukocytes, nitrite, pH, protein, specific gravity, and urobilinogen via dipstick.
evaluation_table.protocol_text: Urinalysis: bilirubin, blood, glucose, ketones, leukocytes (white blood cells), nitrite, pH, protein, specific gravity, urobilinogen and microscopic examination
evaluation_table.reasoning: Generated SAP lists specific parameters matching the Protocol.

evaluation_table.original_sap_text: The results for all non-numeric urinalysis parameters including microscopic urinalysis collected as qualitative format will be categorized into normal and abnormal...
evaluation_table.generated_sap_text: Microscopic examination and 24-hour urine collection (for protein) will be performed if indicated.
evaluation_table.protocol_text: microscopic examination... 24 hour urine collection if indicated at Screening
evaluation_table.reasoning: Generated SAP includes these conditional assessments.

evaluation_table.original_sap_text: Coagulation (prothrombin time, prothrombin time international normalized ratio) test will be performed...
evaluation_table.generated_sap_text: Coagulation: Prothrombin time (PT) and prothrombin time international normalized ratio (INR) (for patients receiving aspirin).
evaluation_table.protocol_text: Coagulation: Any patients who continue with low dose aspirin... should perform prothrombin time and prothrombin time international normalized ratio tests.
evaluation_table.reasoning: Generated SAP correctly identifies the parameters and the condition (aspirin use).

evaluation_table.original_sap_text: The baseline value for all analyses will be the last non-missing value prior to the first infusion unless otherwise specified.
evaluation_table.generated_sap_text: Baseline is defined in Section 4.2.
evaluation_table.reasoning: Generated SAP references its own definition section, which is standard practice.

evaluation_table.original_sap_text: Laboratory data will be summarized in the Induction Study Period... Maintenance Study Period... Follow-Up Period...
evaluation_table.generated_sap_text: Post-baseline summaries will include all scheduled visits during the Induction Study Period (Cycles 1 through 6), Maintenance Study Period (Cycles 1 and every 3 cycles thereafter), and the End of Treatment (EOT) visit.
evaluation_table.reasoning: Original SAP explicitly includes the Follow-Up Period in the summary scope logic. Generated SAP omits the Follow-Up Period from the list of periods to be summarized.

evaluation_table.original_sap_text: Clinical chemistry, hematology, urinalysis and coagulation data will be presented in separate listings...
evaluation_table.generated_sap_text: All laboratory data will be included in the data listings.
evaluation_table.reasoning: Both require listings for all data.

evaluation_table.original_sap_text: Actual result and change from baseline of all numeric laboratory parameters including clinical chemistry, hematology, numeric urinalysis and coagulation will be summarized...
evaluation_table.generated_sap_text: Summaries of actual values and change from baseline will be provided for hematology and clinical chemistry.
evaluation_table.reasoning: Original SAP requires summaries for numeric urinalysis and coagulation. Generated SAP restricts summaries to hematology and clinical chemistry.

evaluation_table.original_sap_text: Actual result and change from baseline of all numeric laboratory parameters including clinical chemistry, hematology, numeric urinalysis and coagulation will be summarized...
evaluation_table.generated_sap_text: Coagulation and urinalysis results will be presented in data listings only.
evaluation_table.reasoning: Direct contradiction: Original SAP mandates summaries for these parameters, while Generated SAP explicitly restricts them to listings only.

evaluation_table.original_sap_text: ...summarized using descriptive statistics by treatment group, laboratory category, test parameter and visit.
evaluation_table.generated_sap_text: Laboratory parameters will be summarized by treatment group and visit using descriptive statistics.
evaluation_table.reasoning: Methodology matches.

evaluation_table.original_sap_text: Actual result and change from baseline...
evaluation_table.generated_sap_text: Summaries will include both actual values and change from baseline values.
evaluation_table.reasoning: Methodology matches.

evaluation_table.original_sap_text: EOT and unscheduled visit will not be summarized in visit-based tables, unless otherwise indicated.
evaluation_table.generated_sap_text: As established in Section 4.5, nominal visits will be used for these summaries. Only scheduled visits will be included in by-visit summaries.
evaluation_table.reasoning: Both exclude unscheduled visits from summary tables.

evaluation_table.original_sap_text: ...according to CTCAE version 5.0.
evaluation_table.generated_sap_text: Laboratory abnormalities will be graded according to the National Cancer Institute (NCI) Common Terminology Criteria for Adverse Events (CTCAE) version 5.0, where applicable.
evaluation_table.reasoning: Version matches.

evaluation_table.original_sap_text: A shift table will be also produced by the Whole Study Period and each study period.
evaluation_table.generated_sap_text: Shift tables will be used to summarize the number and percentage of patients by baseline category (Grade 0 through 4) versus the worst post-baseline category.
evaluation_table.reasoning: Original SAP requires shift tables for the Whole Study Period AND each study period (Induction, Maintenance). Generated SAP defines 'worst post-baseline' as 'during the Whole Study Period', implying only one shift table.

evaluation_table.original_sap_text: Only the most severe case during unscheduled and scheduled visits will be included for the post-baseline result in the shift table.
evaluation_table.generated_sap_text: Worst post-baseline value is defined as the most extreme CTCAE grade observed during the Whole Study Period (as defined in Section 4.2), including results from unscheduled assessments.
evaluation_table.reasoning: Both include unscheduled visits in the worst value determination.

evaluation_table.original_sap_text: The results for all non-numeric urinalysis parameters including microscopic urinalysis collected as qualitative format will be categorized into normal and abnormal... and will be summarized in a shift table.
evaluation_table.generated_sap_text: For parameters not covered by CTCAE grading, shift tables will cross-classify patients by baseline category (Low, Normal, High) relative to the laboratory reference range versus the worst post-baseline category.
evaluation_table.reasoning: Original SAP specifically requires shift tables for qualitative urinalysis (Normal/Abnormal). Generated SAP restricts urinalysis to listings only (see Element 13) and defines non-CTCAE shift tables as Low/Normal/High (numeric), omitting the qualitative requirement.

evaluation_table.original_sap_text: Clinical chemistry, hematology, urinalysis and coagulation data will be presented in separate listings along with high or low flags for numeric parameter...
evaluation_table.generated_sap_text: Analyses will be performed separately for the "High" and "Low" directions when both are clinically relevant (e.g., potassium).
evaluation_table.reasoning: Consistent with standard practice and Original SAP's mention of high/low flags.

evaluation_table.original_sap_text: The number and percentage of patients with a result for each grade will be summarized by laboratory category, CTCAE term, visit and CTCAE grade.
evaluation_table.generated_sap_text: The number and percentage of patients with treatment-emergent laboratory abnormalities (defined as an increase in CTCAE grade from baseline) will be summarized by treatment group.
evaluation_table.reasoning: Generated SAP adds a specific summary for treatment-emergent abnormalities, which is consistent with the Original SAP's requirement for grade summaries and shift tables.

evaluation_table.original_sap_text: The number and percentage of patients with a result for each grade will be summarized...
evaluation_table.generated_sap_text: Particular focus will be placed on Grade 3 or 4 abnormalities.
evaluation_table.reasoning: Consistent with standard safety reporting.

evaluation_table.original_sap_text: EOT and unscheduled visit will not be summarized in visit-based tables, unless otherwise indicated.
evaluation_table.generated_sap_text: Unscheduled laboratory assessments will be excluded from by-visit summaries but will be included in the determination of the worst post-baseline values and in all listings.
evaluation_table.reasoning: Matches exclusion rule.

evaluation_table.original_sap_text: When combining data from eCRF and analytical facilities discrepancy will be handled as following...
evaluation_table.generated_sap_text: If multiple laboratory values are collected on the same study day, the value collected closest to the scheduled assessment time will be used for by-visit summaries.
evaluation_table.reasoning: Generated SAP provides a specific rule for multiple values, which is a standard clarification not contradicting the Original SAP.

evaluation_table.original_sap_text: Only the most severe case during unscheduled and scheduled visits will be included for the post-baseline result in the shift table.
evaluation_table.generated_sap_text: For the determination of the worst post-baseline value, the most extreme value among all results (scheduled or unscheduled) for that day will be used.
evaluation_table.reasoning: Matches the 'most severe case' logic.

evaluation_table.original_sap_text: Actual result and change from baseline of all numeric laboratory parameters including clinical chemistry, hematology, numeric urinalysis and coagulation will be summarized...
evaluation_table.generated_sap_text: Summary of Hematology Parameters by Visit - Actual Values and Change from Baseline
evaluation_table.reasoning: Matches requirement for hematology summary.

evaluation_table.original_sap_text: Clinical chemistry, hematology, urinalysis and coagulation data will be presented in separate listings...
evaluation_table.generated_sap_text: Laboratory Results: Hematology
evaluation_table.reasoning: Matches requirement for hematology listing.

missing_from_generated_sap.original_sap_text: Grades that require clinical input only will not be assigned to these parameters. Grades which are part numeric and part clinical input will be assigned based on the numeric portion only.
missing_from_generated_sap.description: Specific rules for handling CTCAE grades requiring clinical input are missing.
missing_from_generated_sap.reasoning: Original SAP specifies how to handle mixed numeric/clinical grades. Generated SAP omits this detail.

missing_from_generated_sap.original_sap_text: Reported parameters with units that cannot be converted to standard units will be summarized separately using the original units.
missing_from_generated_sap.description: Handling of parameters with non-convertible units is missing.
missing_from_generated_sap.reasoning: Original SAP specifies separate summary for non-standard units. Generated SAP omits this.

issues.original_sap_text: Actual result and change from baseline of all numeric laboratory parameters including clinical chemistry, hematology, numeric urinalysis and coagulation will be summarized...
issues.generated_sap_text: Coagulation and urinalysis results will be presented in data listings only.
issues.why_they_conflict: Original SAP mandates summaries for numeric urinalysis and coagulation, while Generated SAP explicitly restricts them to listings only.
issues.description: Generated SAP removes required summaries for coagulation and urinalysis parameters.
issues.reasoning: Chain-of-thought: 1) Original SAP explicitly states numeric urinalysis and coagulation 'will be summarized'. 2) Generated SAP explicitly states they 'will be presented in data listings only'. 3) These are mutually exclusive instructions. 4) This reduces the scope of safety reporting for these parameters.

issues.original_sap_text: The results for all non-numeric urinalysis parameters including microscopic urinalysis collected as qualitative format will be categorized into normal and abnormal... and will be summarized in a shift table.
issues.generated_sap_text: Coagulation and urinalysis results will be presented in data listings only.
issues.why_they_conflict: Original SAP mandates shift tables for qualitative urinalysis, while Generated SAP restricts urinalysis to listings only.
issues.description: Generated SAP removes required shift tables for qualitative urinalysis parameters.
issues.reasoning: Chain-of-thought: 1) Original SAP requires shift tables (Normal/Abnormal) for qualitative urinalysis. 2) Generated SAP restricts all urinalysis to listings only. 3) This removes a required safety analysis.

reverse_check.original_sap_statement: EOT and unscheduled visit will not be summarized in visit-based tables, unless otherwise indicated.
The CTCAE Grade 5 (Death) will not be applied in this analysis since death cannot be determined from a laboratory result.
reverse_check.explanation: Generated SAP is silent on this, which is a missing specification but not a contradiction.

reverse_check.original_sap_statement: Grades that require clinical input only will not be assigned to these parameters.
reverse_check.explanation: Generated SAP is silent on this.

reverse_check.original_sap_statement: Only the most severe case during unscheduled and scheduled visits will be included for the post-baseline result in the shift table.
Coagulation and urinalysis results will be presented in data listings only.
reverse_check.explanation: This reverse check confirms the contradiction found in the forward check: Original SAP requires summaries, Generated SAP restricts to listings.

extra_information_flagged.detail: Generated SAP lists parameters explicitly (matching Protocol), whereas Original SAP refers to an appendix.
extra_information_flagged.reasoning: This is a helpful addition that aligns with the Protocol.

extra_information_flagged.generated_sap_text: The number and percentage of patients with treatment-emergent laboratory abnormalities... will be summarized...
extra_information_flagged.detail: Generated SAP adds a specific summary for treatment-emergent abnormalities.
extra_information_flagged.reasoning: This aligns with the intent of shift tables and grade summaries in the Original SAP.

reasoning: The Generated SAP accurately captures the core laboratory analysis requirements for hematology and clinical chemistry, including descriptive statistics, CTCAE grading, and shift tables. However, it introduces a direct contradiction by restricting coagulation and urinalysis to 'listings only', whereas the Original SAP explicitly requires summaries for numeric parameters and shift tables for qualitative urinalysis. Additionally, the Generated SAP omits the Follow-Up Period from the summary scope and lacks the detailed period assignment logic found in the Original SAP. While these are deviations, they do not fundamentally compromise the primary safety analysis of the trial, resulting in a DECENT rating.
summary: The Generated SAP is generally accurate but contains a minor contradiction regarding the reporting of coagulation and urinalysis data (listings only vs. summaries required). It also omits summaries for the Follow-Up Period and lacks detailed logic for assigning results to study periods.

removed_items.original_sap_text: Laboratory data will be summarized in the Induction Study Period if patients: entered the Maintenance Study Period and have an assessment date prior to the date of the first infusion... [detailed logic for Induction, Maintenance, Follow-up]
removed_items.description: Detailed logic for assigning laboratory results to specific study periods (Induction vs Maintenance vs Follow-up) based on infusion dates is missing.
removed_items.reasoning: Original SAP provides precise rules for period assignment. Generated SAP lists the periods but omits the assignment logic.
removed_items.found_in_section: Section 4.2: Key Definitions and Section 7.1.3.2: Analysis Timepoints
removed_items.reconciliation_reasoning: The generated SAP defines the specific temporal boundaries for the 'Induction Study Period', 'Maintenance Study Period', and 'Follow-Up Period' in Section 4.2. Additionally, Section 7.1.3.2 explicitly states that laboratory data will be summarized according to these periods. Together, these sections establish the logic for assigning data points to specific study periods based on assessment dates relative to treatment milestones, satisfying the core requirement.

removed_items.original_sap_text: A shift table will be also produced by the Whole Study Period and each study period.
removed_items.description: Requirement for shift tables by 'each study period' (Induction, Maintenance) is missing.
removed_items.reasoning: Generated SAP only specifies shift tables for the Whole Study Period (Baseline vs Worst Post-Baseline).
removed_items.reconciliation_reasoning: Section 4.1 (General Methodology) establishes the general rule that all summaries will be presented by study period (Induction, Maintenance, and Whole Study Period) unless specified otherwise. Section 7.1.3.4 (Toxicity Grading and Shift Tables) explicitly describes the creation of shift tables and defines the worst post-baseline value for the Whole Study Period. The combination of the general methodology requiring summaries by period and the specific section defining the shift table construct satisfies the requirement.
